name: Hat Hill to Levin Down walk, Drovers Estate

ai.summary: Hat Hill to Levin Down walk is a 13.1 km moderate hike in the UK countryside, starting at Hat Hill and finishing at Levin Down via Drovers Estate. The route blends chalk downland, woodlands, and open moorland with a mix of quiet tracks, gentle ups, and occasional steeper sections, suitable for hikers with some hill walking experience.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain combines chalk downland paths, grassy bridleways, woodland tracks and occasional surfaced sections. Expect uneven footing, possible mud after rain, short climbs, gates and stiles, and exposed ridge sections on the downs with wide views.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for about 4–5 hours depending on pace. Check the weather forecast before setting out; exposed windy conditions on the downs can be challenging. Bring a map and compass and do not rely on mobile navigation alone; carry a fully charged phone as a backup. Stay on marked paths, watch for cattle in certain fields, and be prepared for sudden changes in weather. Inform someone of your route and expected finishing time. Carry enough water and snacks, and be prepared for muddier sections after rain.
recommended_gear: Water and high energy snacks (2–3 litres of water, plus snacks)
Layered clothing plus waterproof and windproof outer layer
Map and compass (or GPS) and a charged phone as backup
Headtorch (in case of delays or low light)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October). Summer offers long daylight and clear views, while spring brings flowers; autumn can be colorful. Winter hiking is possible but often windy, cold, and muddy with shorter daylight.
